node.title: More COVID-19 exposure sites identified in SA's south-east
node.alt: An old beige limestone building with windows and umbrellas out the front
node.description: Six new exposure sites are listed in Robe, despite the state recording no new cases of COVID-19 yesterday.
node.content:
["SA Health has identified six new\u00a0exposure sites in Robe, in the state's south- east, despite no new COVID-19 cases recorded\u00a0in South Australia yesterday.\u00a0", "Robe Seafood & Takeaway has been identified as a close contact site from 10:30am to 11am on Friday, November 26.", "Inside patrons at the Caledonian Inn on Thursday, November 25 between\u00a07:15pm and 8:45pm have also been deemed close contacts.", "Other venues including the Union Cafe, Robe Caltex, and outside patrons at the Caledonian Inn have been deemed casual contacts.", "More information and health advice is available on the SA Health website.", "SA Health would not confirm if the new exposure sites related to an existing case, or one yet to be announced.", "Health Minister Stephen Wade also declined to comment.", "There are seven active cases in South Australia, five are interstate arrivals and two are overseas acquired.", "
Booster shots open to all
", "While South Australia is yet to record any cases infected with the new Omicron variant, the state government is warning against vaccine complacency.", "From today, all SA Health-operated clinics will offer booster shots\u00a0to people aged over 18, who received their second dose at least six months ago.", "Previously, booster shots were reserved for frontline health, aged care, and quarantine workers, and other vulnerable cohorts like the elderly, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people aged over 55, and emergency services workers.", "Health Minister Stephen Wade said increasing the availability of booster shots was crucial to keeping South Australians safe.", "\"Two doses does give you good protection against severe disease, but a\u00a0booster will ensure your protection is both stronger, and lasts longer,\" he said.", "", "
South Australian Health Minister Stephen Wade is warning against vaccine complacency in the face of the Omicron variant.(ABC News: Michael Clements)
", "
Omicron variant makes vaccination 'more urgent'
", "The Health Minister\u00a0said clinicians were currently undertaking research to see how existing vaccines reacted to the new Omicron variant.", "\"There's no evidence\u00a0to suggest that the vaccines would be less effective against the Omicron variant,\" he said.", "\"The very encouraging aspect of the vaccine technology is that they can be adapted.\"", "Of South Australians aged 16 and older,\u00a080.8\u00a0per cent are now fully vaccinated, and 89.4 per cent have received their first dose.", "\"We've done a great job in reaching that milestone,\" Mr Wade said.", "\"We want to push on towards the goal of 90 per cent vaccination for 12 and over.", "\"Omicron only makes that task more urgent.\""]
